sentences.sContent: Harvard university was named after John Harvard, a Puritan minister who left his books and half of his estate to the college.
sentences.sContent_eng: Harvard university was named after John Harvard, a Puritan minister who left his books and half of his estate to the college.
sentences.sCn: 哈佛大学就得名于约翰•哈佛，一个将他的所有书籍和半数财产都留给学校的清教徒牧师。

sentences.sContent: Here I am in a pulpit, dressed like a Puritan minister —an apparition that would have horrified many of my distinguished forebears and perhaps rededicated some of them to the extirpation of witches.
sentences.sContent_eng: Here I am in a pulpit, dressed like a Puritan minister —an apparition that would have horrified many of my distinguished forebears and perhaps rededicated some of them to the extirpation of witches.
sentences.sCn: 站在这个讲坛上，我穿得像个清教徒教长——一个可能会吓到我的杰出前辈们的怪物，或许使他们中的一些人重新致力于铲除巫婆的事业上。

trans.tranOther: The Puritans were a group of English Protestants in the sixteenth and seventeenth centuries who lived in a very strict and religious way
